title: How to Make Strawberry White Hot Chocolate

steps.headline: Place the strawberries in a large bowl and sprinkle the sugar.
Allow the strawberries to sit for about 10 minutes.
Blend the strawberries in a food processor or blender until the mixture is smooth.
Pour the strawberry puree through a sieve and remove the seeds.
Simmer the milk.
steps.description: Pour the milk into a saucepan and allow the milk to simmer over low heat, whisking occasionally.

steps.headline: Add the white chocolate.
steps.description: When the milk starts to bubble slightly, remove from heat and stir in the white chocolate. Whisk until fully melted and smooth.

steps.headline: Fold in the puree, vanilla, and salt into the milk mixture.
Add 4-5 drops of red food coloring if desired.
steps.description: Mix until the hot chocolate is a bright pink color.

steps.headline: Pour the hot chocolate into mugs.
Serve.
steps.description: Garnish the hot chocolate with whipped cream if desired. Enjoy!

text: Place the strawberries in a large bowl and sprinkle the sugar. Toss the strawberries until well-combined. Allow the strawberries to sit for about 10 minutes.  Blend the strawberries in a food processor or blender until the mixture is smooth.  Pour the strawberry puree through a sieve and remove the seeds.  Simmer the milk. Pour the milk into a saucepan and allow the milk to simmer over low heat, whisking occasionally. Add the white chocolate. When the milk starts to bubble slightly, remove from heat and stir in the white chocolate. Whisk until fully melted and smooth. Fold in the puree, vanilla, and salt into the milk mixture. Stir well with the whisk. Add 4-5 drops of red food coloring if desired. Mix until the hot chocolate is a bright pink color. Pour the hot chocolate into mugs.  Serve. Garnish the hot chocolate with whipped cream if desired. Enjoy! Finished.
